## MemPoolOpts interface

<b>Signature:</b>

```typescript
export interface MemPoolOpts 
```

## Properties

|  Property | Type | Description |
|  --- | --- | --- |
|  [align](./malloc.mempoolopts.align.md) | <code>Pow2</code> | Number of bytes to align memory blocks to. MUST be a power of 2 and &gt;<!-- -->= 8. Use 16 if the pool is being used for allocating memory used in SIMD operations. |
|  [buf](./malloc.mempoolopts.buf.md) | <code>ArrayBufferLike</code> | Backing ArrayBuffer (or SharedArrayBuffer). If not given, a new one will be created with given <code>size</code>. |
|  [compact](./malloc.mempoolopts.compact.md) | <code>boolean</code> | Flag to configure memory block compaction. If true, adjoining free blocks (in terms of address space) will be merged to minimize fragementation. |
|  [end](./malloc.mempoolopts.end.md) | <code>number</code> | Byte address (+1) of the end of the memory region managed by the <code>MemPool</code>. |
|  [minSplit](./malloc.mempoolopts.minsplit.md) | <code>number</code> | Only used if <code>split</code> behavior is enabled. Defines min number of excess bytes available in a block for memory block splitting to occur. |
|  [size](./malloc.mempoolopts.size.md) | <code>number</code> | Byte size for newly created ArrayBuffers (if <code>buf</code> is not given). |
|  [skipInitialization](./malloc.mempoolopts.skipinitialization.md) | <code>boolean</code> | Only needed when sharing the underlying ArrayBuffer. If true, the <code>MemPool</code> constructor will NOT initialize its internal state and assume the underlying ArrayBuffer has already been initialized by another <code>MemPool</code> instance. If this option is used, <code>buf</code> MUST be given. |
|  [split](./malloc.mempoolopts.split.md) | <code>boolean</code> | Flag to configure memory block splitting. If true, and when the allocator is re-using a previously freed block larger than the requested size, the block will be split to minimize wasted/unused memory. The splitting behavior can further customized via the <code>minSplit</code> option. |
|  [start](./malloc.mempoolopts.start.md) | <code>number</code> | Anchor index (byte address) inside the array buffer. The MemPool stores its internal state from the given address and heap space starts at least 32 bytes later (depending on chosen <code>align</code> value). Unlike allocator state variables, <code>start</code>\` cannot be saved inside the array buffer itself. If the ArrayBuffer is passed to other consumers they must use the same start value. MUST be multiple of 4. |
